name: Toronto Horror Film Festival
description:
A celebration of independent horror cinema, dedicated to providing filmmakers a platform to showcase their work to a passionate audience.

Experience the magic and thrills of independent horror with a focus on community, creativity, and inclusivity. This festival strives to be a key event for genre lovers in the city, providing an unforgettable night of cinematic terror and celebration.

name: Inside Out Toronto 2SLGBTQ+ Film Festival
description: Marking 35 years of celebrating bold, brilliant and trailblazing queer cinema from Canada and around the world.

name: King East Design District Party
description:
Celebrate design, creativity, and community with DesignTO in Toronto's vibrant King East Design District (KEDD)!

The KEDD Party returns as a roaming neighbourhood celebration, with six dynamic Party Hubs offering unique experiences at every stop. Whether you hop between hubs or settle in at your favourite, this can't-miss night brings together designers, design-lovers, and curious creatives for an evening of connection and discovery.

Party hubs include: Artopex, Blinds To Go, Candace & Basil, Design Within Reach Toronto, Engel & Völkers and Home Société.

name: A Night on Earth with The Macallan at Enigma
description:
You are invited to an evening where time, place, and tradition converge—a journey through three countries, three flavors, and three distinct expressions of The Macallan. Rooted in the essence of renewal and new beginnings, currently reflected in our changing season, celebrated across Scotland, Hong Kong, and Spain, this experience unfolds through a carefully curated menu, each course reflecting the spirit and heritage of these regions.

A celebration of craftsmanship, storytelling, and the quiet elegance of whisky shared among those who appreciate its depth.

name: The Bentway Sun/Shade Opening Night Party
description:
Throw on your best pair of shades and join us for our fabulous party to kick-off summer in the city! Dance under the Gardiner with friends and neighbours among our just-opened public art exhibition Sun/Shade. Enjoy beats from local DJs Juana Gogo and Sandy Watts or grab a bite from your favourite food trucks. Canada's Drag Race's Jada Shada Hudson hosts and keeps the energy up as the sun sets.

Don't miss our incredible Sunglasses at Night fashion show! Bring your coolest sun protection, sunglasses, hat, parasol, visor,  and strut your stuff on runway alongside looks from hot local designers. Runway shy? Come dance and enjoy the show, which kicks off just after sunset at 9pm!

name: Candle Painting Workshop
description: Paint your own elegant taper candles using melted coloured wax in this cozy, candlelit workshop. Enjoy tea, snacks, and soft music as you relax into the rhythm of creating four beautiful, hand-decorated candles. No experience needed, just bring your love of artful moments.

name: Canvas Connection - Date Night Paint Night Workshop
description: A candle-lit, romantic and artistic evening like no other! Bring your partner out for a unique experience where you'll collaborate to create a set of two paintings that will make one connected masterpiece together!

name: The Oldest Profession
description:
This is a mad dash through 10,000 years of history from a sex worker's perspective. Kaytlin Bailey weaves history, stand up comedy, and lived experience in this fast paced and profoundly moving solo show.

Hosted by Kaytlin Bailey, Founder and Executive Director at Old Pros, a nonprofit that uses storytelling for advocating and host of The Oldest Profession Podcast, where every episode is a deep dive into a different sex worker from history.

name: Inside Out Toronto 2SLGBTQ+ Film Festival
description:
35th anniversary edition!

Celebrate queer stories, voices, and visions with nine days of bold cinema, unforgettable events, and community connection. From world premieres to groundbreaking shorts, parties to panels — this is the space where queer film takes centre stage.

Cinema. Community. Be part of it.

name: AGO 125 - Swing Dancing

location.name: Walker Court, Art Gallery of Ontario

description: Join us in Walker Court for an evening with Bee's Knees Dance. Inspired by the vibrant social dances of the 1930s, this lively program begins with a high-energy swing demonstration, followed by a participatory group dance. Whether you're dancing or just taking it all in, come experience the fun, laughter, and movement that defined an era. No experience is needed, just bring your energy and enthusiasm!

name: Thistletown Streets Plan Interactive Map
description:
The City of Toronto invites you to learn more about Thistletown Streets Plan and provide feedback by identifying areas of concern and potential improvements related to traffic and road safety in the project area. Provide your feedback using the interactive map and survey below by June 10, 2025. 
To learn more about the project, public consultation events, and to subscribe to email updates, please visit the project webpage.
